intro: Maba soubreana, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, aromatic aril. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
